intro: Scleria achtenii, commonly known as the African flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, stream banks, and swampy areas. Its stems are triangular in cross-section, a characteristic feature of many sedges. Scleria achtenii produces small, clustered flowers that are often green or brown, and it is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage.
